create_layers::text_card_4::text: This image highlights the context of the story — the game — by placing it in the foreground and placing the subject in the background.
create_layers::preview_card_1::header: In this photo the context layer is in color.
create_layers::text_card_3::text: The context layer is often the background layer. It helps the viewer better understand a subject's environment or an important detail of the story. In this photo the context layer tells the viewer the women are at a protest.
create_layers::preview_card_2::header: Sometimes the layers are reversed, here the context layer is in the foreground.
create_layers::text_card_1::text: The most basic way to use layers is with two distinct layers: a subject layer and a context layer. The context layer provides additional information related to your subject.
create_layers::intro_card_0::headline: Create Layers
create_layers::text_card_5::text: Congratulations, you've learned the basics to creating layers in a photo. Practice your new skill in the activity below.
create_layers::text_card_0::text: Layers help the two-dimensional space of a photo better represent the three-dimensional world. This lesson will teach you the basic steps to create photos with layers.
create_layers::preview_card_0::header: In this photo the subject layer is in color.
create_layers::title: Create Layers
create_layers::text_card_2::text: The subject layer shows the main subject of your photo. This is usually a person or an object. The subject layer is often placed in the foreground layer of your frame.
